ace.optionOne: What group has the highest status in the community? What must people do to gain inclusion in this group?
ace.optionTwo: Are there distinct family units in the community? If so, what family structures are common?

king.optionOne: A young boy starts digging in the ground, and discovers something unexpected. What is it?
king.optionTwo: An old man confesses to past crimes and atrocities. What has he done?

queen.optionOne: What’s the most beautiful thing in this area?
queen.optionTwo: What’s the most hideous thing in this area?

jack.optionOne: You see a good omen. What is it?
jack.optionTwo: You see a bad omen. What is it?

ten.optionOne: There’s another community somewhere on the map. Where are they? What sets them apart from you?
ten.optionTwo: What belief or practice helps to unify your community?

nine.optionOne: A charismatic young girl convinces many to help her with an elaborate scheme. What is it? Who joins her endeavors? Start a project to reflect.
nine.optionTwo: A charismatic young girl tries to tempt many into sinful or dangerous activity. Why does she do this? How does the community respond?

eight.optionOne: An old piece of machinery is discovered, broken but perhaps repairable. What is it? What would it be useful for?
eight.optionTwo: An old piece of machinery is discovered, cursed and dangerous. How does the community destroy it?

seven.optionOne: Where does everyone sleep? Who is unhappy with this arrangement, and why?
seven.optionTwo: What natural predators roam this area? Are you safe?

six.optionOne: Are there children in the community? If there are, what is their role in the community?
six.optionTwo: How old are the eldest members of the community? What unique needs do they have?

five.optionOne: There is a disquieting legend about this place. What is it?
five.optionTwo: Alarming weather patterns destroy something. How and what?

four.optionOne: What important and basic tools does the community lack?
four.optionTwo: Where are you storing your food? Why is this a risky place to store things?

three.optionTwo: Two of the community’s younger members get into a fight. What provoked them?

two.optionOne: There’s a large body of water on the map. Where is it? What does it look like?
two.optionTwo: There’s a giant man-made structure on the map. Where is it? Why is it abandoned?

ace.optionOne: A contingent within the community demand to be heard. Who are they? What are they asking for?
ace.optionTwo: A contingent within the community have acted on their frustrations. What have they damaged, and why did they damage it? Is it permanent?

king.optionTwo: Discard the top two cards off the top of the deck and take two actions this week.

queen.optionOne: A project finishes early. Which one? Why?
queen.optionTwo: If there are no projects underway, boredom leads to a quarrel. A fight breaks out between two people. What is it about?

jack.optionOne: Predators and bad omens are afoot. You are careless, and someone goes missing under ominous circumstances. Who?
jack.optionTwo: Predators and bad omens are afoot. What measures do you take to keep everyone safe and under surveillance? Do not reduce project dice this week.

ten.optionOne: You discover a cache of supplies or resources. Add a new Abundance.
ten.optionTwo: A Scarcity has gone unaddressed for too long! Start a project that will alleviate that Scarcity.

nine.optionOne: A project fails. Which one? Why?
nine.optionTwo: Something goes foul and supplies are ruined. Add a new Scarcity.

eight.optionOne: Someone tries to take control of the community by force. Do they succeed? Why do they do this?
eight.optionTwo: A headstrong community member decides to put one of their ideas in motion. Start a foolish project.

seven.optionOne: Introduce a mystery at the edge of the map.
seven.optionTwo: An unattended situation becomes problematic and scary. What is it? How does it go awry?

six.optionOne: Outsiders arrive in the area. Why are they a threat? How are they vulnerable?
six.optionTwo: Outsiders arrive in the area. How many? How are they greeted?

five.optionOne: A project finishes early. What led to its early completion?
five.optionTwo: The weather is nice and people can feel the potential all around them. Start a new project.

four.optionOne: The eldest among you dies. What caused the death?
four.optionTwo: The eldest among you is very sick. Caring for them and searching for a cure requires the help of the entire community. Do not reduce project dice this week.

three.optionOne: Summer is a time for production and tending to the earth. Start a project related to food production.
three.optionTwo: Summer is a time for conquest and the gathering of might. Start a project related to military readiness and conquest.

two.optionOne: Someone new arrives. Who? Why are they in distress?
two.optionTwo: Someone leaves the community. Who? What are they looking for?
